summary: This document is an email chain from June 8, 2021, between DOJ personnel discussing the identification of Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys and two individuals who visited him in jail in connection with his will. The correspondence clarifies public sources for attorney names and identifies visitors reported in news articles.

keyFacts: The document lists six defense attorneys who formally appeared in Jeffrey Epstein's case: James Brochin, Marc Allan Fernich, Martin Weinberg, Michael Miller, Michael Scavelli, and Reid Weingarten.
Two individuals, Mariel Colon Miro and Gulnora Tali, were identified as having visited Epstein in jail in connection with his will, based on widespread news reports.
The inquiry originates from DOJ Office of the Inspector General agents working on a report concerning Epstein, related to the MCC guard case.
The correspondence highlights the challenge of reading the MCC attorney log, which was either illegible or contained incomplete names.
The information shared is confirmed to be public, sourced from ECF (Electronic Case Files) and news articles.
